results.title: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: A family setting out on a picnic prepare by taking adequate food, water and first aid equipment. The danger of fire in the bush is emphasised, and the film also stresses the need to protect the fauna. Note: In Greek.
results.title_for_label: Ask an Australian about the outdoors [Greek version]

results.title: Ask an Australian about pedestrians [Spanish version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: The numerous hazards facing a pedestrian in a busy Australian city are pointed out. The importance of observing signals, crossing on pedestrian overpasses or crosswalks, and carefully watching traffic are emphasised. Note: In Spanish.

results.title: Ask an Australian about flora and fauna [Spanish version]
results.creator_credit: Kay Roberts and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description: An introduction to the flowers, animals and birds of Australia, highlighting the role of national parks and sanctuaries in the preservation of native shrubs, flowers and creatures and stressing the laws covering the protection of fauna and flora generally. Note: In Spanish.

results.title: Asia: a continental overview
results.brief_description: Examines the principle physical regions of Asia in terms of natural resources and human use. Gives a picture of the wide range of living conditions on this largest and most populous of the continents and emphasizes the many changes taking place in centuries-old patterns of life. No other credits available.
results.description: Examines the principle physical regions of Asia in terms of natural resources and human use. No other credits available.

results.title: As old as the hills
results.brief_description: A history of oil from dinosaur days to the sinking of a present-day oil well. Shows how oil was formed over one hundred million years ago as a result of the decomposition of marine and plant life, and explains how rock movements over the ages have trapped the oil in porous layers in the earth’s crust.
